policies.name: Audit and Accountability Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing audit logging, event type selection, and audit function coordination
policies.rationale: NIST 03.03.01 requires organizations to 'specify event types selected for logging' and 'coordinate the event logging function with other organizational entities' which necessitates formal policy guidance on audit and accountability practices

procedures.name: Event Type Selection and Documentation Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for identifying system logging capabilities, coordinating with stakeholders, selecting event types, and documenting rationale for selections
procedures.rationale: Control requires identifying 'types of events that the system is capable of logging' and providing 'a rationale for why the event types selected for logging are deemed to be adequate'

procedures.name: Event Type Review and Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic review of selected event types, evaluation of adequacy, and updating selections based on changing requirements
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.03.01 requires 'Review and update the event types selected for logging [organization-defined frequency]'

procedures.name: Audit Coordination Procedure
procedures.description: Process for coordinating with organizational entities requiring audit information to inform event type selection criteria
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'Coordinate the event logging function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information'

executionEvidence.name: Event Type Selection Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documented list showing: system logging capabilities identified, event types selected for logging, rationale for each selection citing investigation needs, coordination with stakeholders documented, approval signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires documentation of selected event types with rationale; must be current to support after-the-fact investigations

executionEvidence.name: Annual Event Type Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: date of review, event types evaluated, changes made to selections, new threats or requirements considered, stakeholder input, reviewer and approver signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires periodic review; annual review aligns with NIST guidance that 'Reviewing and updating the set of logged event types are necessary to ensure that the current set remains relevant'

executionEvidence.name: Audit Coordination Meeting Minutes
executionEvidence.description: Meeting records showing: entities coordinated with (security team, incident response, compliance, legal), audit requirements discussed, event type decisions influenced by coordination, action items
executionEvidence.frequency: Annually or when significant system changes occur
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates execution of coordination requirement to 'guide and inform the selection criteria for events to be logged'

operationalActivities: Identify and document system logging capabilities
Coordinate with security, compliance, incident response, and legal teams on audit needs
Select specific event types for logging based on security requirements
Document rationale for each event type selection
Review and update event type selections annually
Update event types when system changes occur
Maintain current documentation of all logging decisions

policies.name: Audit and Accountability Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining required audit record content fields and standards for audit information capture
policies.rationale: NIST 03.03.02 requires audit records to 'Include the following content' with six mandatory fields, necessitating policy-level definition of audit record standards

procedures.name: Audit Record Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for configuring systems to capture all six required audit record fields (what, when, where, source, outcome, identity) plus any additional information needed
procedures.rationale: Control requires ensuring 'audit records contain information that establishes' specific content; requires documented procedure for system configuration

procedures.name: Audit Log Format Verification Procedure
procedures.description: Process for verifying audit records contain all required fields, reviewing sample logs, and validating completeness of captured information
procedures.rationale: Organizations must verify that audit records actually contain the required content elements after configuration

executionEvidence.name: Audit Record Configuration Documentation
executionEvidence.description: System configuration exports or screenshots showing: event type, timestamp, location, source IP/system, success/failure outcome, user identity configured for capture in audit logs
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates systems are configured to capture all six mandatory content fields required by NIST

executionEvidence.name: Sample Audit Record Validation Reports
executionEvidence.description: Quarterly validation reports showing: sample audit records extracted, verification that each contains what/when/where/source/outcome/identity, gaps identified, remediation completed
executionEvidence.rationale: Provides recurring evidence that audit records actually contain required content in practice, not just in configuration

executionEvidence.name: Audit Content Standards Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation defining: required audit fields, additional information needed for specific event types (privileged commands, group account users, etc.), timestamp format standards, retention of detailed content
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion notes that 'Audit record content that may be necessary to support the auditing function includes time stamps, source and destination addresses, user or process identifiers' requiring documented standards

operationalActivities: Configure all systems to capture six mandatory audit record fields
Enable detailed logging for privileged operations
Configure timestamp generation using authorized time sources
Verify sample audit records contain all required content quarterly
Update audit configurations when new systems are deployed
Document any additional audit content needed for specific event types

policies.name: Audit and Accountability Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy requiring audit record generation for selected event types across all system components
policies.rationale: NIST 03.03.03 requires 'Generate audit records for the selected event types' which must be mandated at policy level

policies.name: Records Retention Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining retention periods for audit logs and other business records
policies.rationale: Control requires 'Retain audit records for a time period consistent with the records retention policy' necessitating formal retention policy

procedures.name: Audit Generation Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for enabling audit logging on all systems, configuring generation of required event types, and verifying audit generation is active
procedures.rationale: Control requires audit records be generated for selected event types at defined system components

procedures.name: Audit Retention Implementation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for configuring audit log retention periods, managing log storage, archiving older logs, and ensuring compliance with retention policy
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.03.03 requires retaining 'audit records for a time period consistent with the records retention policy'

procedures.name: Audit Storage Capacity Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for monitoring audit log storage capacity, managing storage growth, and preventing storage-related audit failures
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion notes audit generation depends on 'system functionality' and organizations must manage storage to prevent failures

executionEvidence.name: Audit Generation Configuration Evidence
executionEvidence.description: System configuration exports showing: audit logging enabled, selected event types configured for generation, logging active on all system components in scope, generation settings match documented requirements
executionEvidence.frequency: Updated when systems or configurations change
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates audit record generation is actually configured and operational for required event types

executionEvidence.name: Monthly Audit Generation Health Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems generating audit logs, volume of audit records generated by system, any gaps in generation identified, generation continuity verified, issues resolved
executionEvidence.rationale: Provides recurring evidence that audit generation is functioning continuously without failures

executionEvidence.name: Audit Retention Policy Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: retention periods defined by record type, retention aligned with legal and regulatory requirements, audit log retention periods specified (typically 1-7 years), archival procedures
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires retention 'consistent with the records retention policy' - must document the policy and its application to audit logs

executionEvidence.name: Audit Retention Compliance Reports
executionEvidence.description: Quarterly reports showing: audit logs retained per policy, oldest logs on hand, retention period compliance verified, expired logs properly disposed, archival process functioning
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing compliance with retention requirements, not just configuration

executionEvidence.name: Audit Storage Capacity Reports
executionEvidence.description: Monthly reports showing: current storage utilization, storage growth trends, capacity planning projections, alerts configured for storage thresholds, storage expansion plans if needed
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion emphasizes importance of selecting 'appropriate level of abstraction' and preventing storage-related failures that would stop audit generation

operationalActivities: Enable audit logging on all systems and system components
Configure generation of audit records for all selected event types from 03.03.01
Monitor audit generation health continuously
Manage audit log storage capacity proactively
Implement retention periods consistent with records retention policy
Archive older audit logs per retention requirements
Verify audit generation continuity monthly
Document any systems where audit generation is limited or disabled

controls.controlTitle: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures

policies.name: Audit and Accountability Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining required responses to audit logging failures, alert timeframes, and escalation procedures
policies.rationale: NIST 03.03.04 requires 'Alert organizational personnel or roles within [organization-defined time period]' and 'Take the following additional actions' which must be defined at policy level

policies.name: Incident Response Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing incident response procedures including handling of audit system failures as security incidents
policies.rationale: Audit logging failures represent security incidents requiring response per incident handling procedures

procedures.name: Audit Logging Failure Response Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for responding to audit failures including: identifying failure type, notifying designated personnel within defined timeframe, taking additional response actions, documenting response
procedures.rationale: Control requires specific actions 'in the event of an audit logging process failure' necessitating documented procedure

procedures.name: Audit Failure Alert Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Process for configuring automated alerts for audit failures, defining alert recipients, setting alert timeframes, and testing alert mechanisms
procedures.rationale: Organizations must configure systems to automatically alert designated personnel within defined timeframes

procedures.name: Audit Health Monitoring Procedure
procedures.description: Process for continuous monitoring of audit logging health, detecting failures, and proactive identification of potential issues before failures occur
procedures.rationale: Effective failure response requires monitoring to detect audit logging process failures promptly

executionEvidence.name: Audit Failure Alert Configuration Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Configuration exports showing: automated alerts configured for audit failures (log generation stopped, storage capacity reached, logging service down), alert recipients defined by role, alert timeframes configured (e.g., within 15 minutes), alert delivery methods
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates proactive configuration to alert personnel within organization-defined timeframe per NIST requirement

executionEvidence.name: Audit Failure Response Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation defining: types of audit failures (software errors, hardware failures, storage capacity, log capture failures), personnel/roles to be alerted, required timeframe for alerts (typically 15-60 minutes), additional response actions (stop system, overwrite oldest records, shutdown, etc.)
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires organizations to define the time period for alerts and additional actions based on 'type of failure, location of failure, severity of failure'

executionEvidence.name: Audit Failure Incident Records
executionEvidence.description: Incident tickets showing: date/time of audit failure, failure type and cause, personnel alerted and alert timestamp, response actions taken, time to resolution, root cause analysis if applicable
executionEvidence.frequency: Created for each audit failure incident
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates actual execution of alert and response procedures when failures occur, proves compliance with defined timeframes

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Alert Testing Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: alert mechanism tested, test scenarios (simulated failures), alerts received by designated personnel, alert delivery time measured, issues identified and resolved
executionEvidence.rationale: Testing verifies alert mechanisms will function when actual failures occur, ensuring personnel can be notified within required timeframes

executionEvidence.name: Monthly Audit Health Monitoring Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: audit logging health monitored continuously, audit generation verified across all systems, storage capacity monitored, no unreported failures, monitoring tools functioning properly
executionEvidence.rationale: Proactive monitoring enables early detection of audit logging issues before they become failures requiring emergency response

operationalActivities: Configure automated alerts for all audit logging failure types
Define personnel/roles to receive audit failure alerts
Set alert timeframes appropriate to failure severity
Test alert mechanisms quarterly to verify functionality
Monitor audit logging health continuously
Respond to audit failures per documented procedure
Alert designated personnel within defined timeframe when failures occur
Take additional response actions per policy (system shutdown, log overwrite, etc.)
Document all audit failure incidents and responses
Conduct root cause analysis for recurring failures

controls.controlTitle: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting

policies.name: Audit and Accountability Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining audit review frequency, analysis requirements, reporting procedures, and personnel responsible for audit review activities
policies.rationale: NIST 03.03.05 requires 'Review and analyze system audit records [organization-defined frequency]' and 'Report findings to organizational personnel or roles' which must be mandated at policy level

policies.name: Incident Response Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing coordination between audit review activities and incident response processes
policies.rationale: Control requires 'Coordinate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes with organizational incident response activities'

procedures.name: Audit Log Review and Analysis Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for reviewing audit logs at defined frequency, analyzing for inappropriate or unusual activity, using automated tools, and documenting findings
procedures.rationale: Control requires organizations to 'Review and analyze system audit records' with defined frequency and scope

procedures.name: Audit Finding Reporting Procedure
procedures.description: Process for reporting audit review findings to designated personnel, escalating security issues, and coordinating with incident response team
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.03.05 requires 'Report findings to organizational personnel or roles' and coordination with incident response

procedures.name: Cross-Repository Audit Correlation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for analyzing and correlating audit records from different systems and repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness'

procedures.name: Audit Review Scope Adjustment Procedure
procedures.description: Process for adjusting review frequency, depth, or scope based on new information, threat intelligence, or organizational needs
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion notes 'The scope, frequency, and/or depth of the audit record review, analysis, and reporting may be adjusted to meet organizational needs based on new information received'

executionEvidence.name: Weekly/Monthly Audit Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: date of review, systems/logs reviewed, time period covered, inappropriate or unusual activity identified, analysis methods used (automated tools, manual review), findings with severity ratings, analyst name and signature
executionEvidence.frequency: Weekly for critical systems, Monthly for standard systems
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: 14 days for weekly reviews, 45 days for monthly reviews
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates regular execution of audit review requirement; NIST discussion notes review should cover 'account usage, remote access, wireless connectivity, configuration settings, privileged functions, failed logons' with organization-defined frequency

executionEvidence.name: Audit Finding Escalation Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: findings identified during reviews, severity/priority assigned, personnel notified (security team, management, incident response), escalation timestamp, acknowledgment of receipt, follow-up actions
executionEvidence.frequency: Created when significant findings are identified
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates findings are 'reported to organizational personnel or roles' as required by control

executionEvidence.name: Security Event Investigation Reports
executionEvidence.description: Investigation reports showing: suspicious activity identified in audit logs, investigation initiated, evidence collected from audit records, root cause determined, incident classification, remediation actions
executionEvidence.rationale: Shows audit review process successfully identifies security issues requiring investigation, demonstrating effectiveness of review activities

executionEvidence.name: Incident Response Coordination Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: audit review findings coordinated with incident response team, audit data provided for incident investigations, communication channels established, joint analysis conducted, lessons learned shared between teams
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires 'Coordinate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes with organizational incident response activities'

executionEvidence.name: Cross-Repository Correlation Analysis Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: audit records from multiple systems analyzed together, correlations identified between events across repositories, organization-wide activity patterns identified, security trends detected, enhanced situational awareness demonstrated
executionEvidence.frequency: Monthly or when investigating security events
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires 'Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories' to gain comprehensive view of security posture

executionEvidence.name: Audit Review Frequency Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: defined review frequencies by system type/criticality (weekly, monthly, quarterly), rationale for frequencies, adjustments made based on threat intelligence or incidents, approval of frequency definitions
executionEvidence.rationale: Organizations must define and document the review frequency as organization-defined parameter in the control

operationalActivities: Review audit logs at organization-defined frequency (weekly/monthly based on system criticality)
Analyze logs for inappropriate or unusual activity using automated tools and manual review
Look for indicators of security issues (failed logons, privilege escalation, unauthorized access, data exfiltration attempts)
Correlate audit records across different systems and repositories
Document all findings from audit reviews
Report findings to designated security personnel
Escalate significant findings to incident response team
Coordinate audit review activities with incident response processes
Adjust review scope, frequency, or depth based on new threats or incidents
Maintain audit review documentation for compliance verification
